bioghist.p: Stewart Culin (1858-1929) was an ethnographer and author interested in games, art and dress. He believed that similarity in gaming demonstrated similarity and contact among cultures across the world. He served as director of the University of Pennsylvania Museum of Archaeology and Paleontology from 1892 to 1903.

scopecontent.p: The collection includes advertisements from 1885. Subjects include clothing, food products and grocers, cigarettes and tobacco, jewelers, restaurants, medicines and medical devices, soaps, bath houses, and shows and events. Formats include broadsides, handbills, and advertising cards.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
